nodes.description: 1995年4月19日9:02，美国俄克拉荷马城阿尔弗雷德·P·默拉联邦大楼遭恐怖袭击，造成168人死亡
nodes.support_text: AT 9:02 A.M., APRIL 19, 1995...the Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building in Oklahoma City was bombed in what would be the single most destructive terrorist act in U.S. history.

nodes.description: 游客在遗址周围触摸纪念物、留言、拍摄，但保持沉默和肃穆
nodes.support_text: Visitors walk along those fences and sidestep the rubble...Some take pictures or videos, but almost no one poses or waves for the cameras.

nodes.description: 居民对媒体过度关注和游客围观感到困扰，部分人无法接受遗址成为旅游景点
nodes.support_text: Mike Hixson...says: 'I still can't bear to stop and see it up close. How people can come up and stare at it as part of their vacation is beyond me.'

nodes.description: 遗址周边建筑受损情况被详细记录，包括Ryder运货车的停放位置导致的破坏范围
nodes.support_text: The Ryder moving truck that carried the bomb was parked at the front of the building...But to the east and west, and especially to the north...the damage is still astonishing.

nodes.description: 居民对爆炸冲击的集体心理反应，包括Edmond居民听到爆炸声和Okie文化认同的冲击
nodes.support_text: Residents in Edmond...heard and felt the blast...I still can't believe something like this could happen here.

nodes.description: 市政府试图平衡历史形象与创伤记忆，筹备土地奔跑周年纪念活动
nodes.support_text: Ask people when they went on vacation...and they will say a couple of weeks before the bombing, or a month after. Later this month, Oklahoma will celebrate the 107th anniversary of the Great Land Run of 1889...

nodes.description: 临时纪念设施建立，包括Heartland礼拜堂和超过20万件捐赠物品的收藏
nodes.support_text: An open-air 'Heartland Chapel' has been erected...More than 200,000 items of tribute A committee has been formed to develop a permanent memorial...

nodes.description: 1996年4月19日9:02举行精确周年纪念仪式，幸存者与救援人员共同参与后续活动
nodes.support_text: The precise anniversary will be observed at 9:02 a.m. Central Time. Later, they will go to the Myriad Convention Center...

nodes.description: 城市修复工作启动，包括建筑拆除和纪念园区规划，救援人员表示创伤需要时间愈合
nodes.support_text: Charles Eschmann...says: 'The city is beginning to heal...Time heals all wounds, isn't that what they say?'

nodes.description: 《纽约时报》对袭击地点展开深度调查
nodes.support_text: 《纽约时报》对袭击地点展开深度调查

Nearly one year after the bombing...people are drawn to the site.

I still can't believe something like this could happen here.
